info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 22 at 8:33AM CDT until March 22 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL NEWTON COUNTY... At 832 AM CDT, a severe squall line capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage was located near Bon Weir, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Newton County, including the following locations... Bleakwood. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
